title: Pep Guardiola surprisingly claims Jack Grealish would cost too much for Manchester City to sign him
text:
Pep Guardiola has made the bold claim that Aston Villa's Jack Grealish is 'too expensive' for Manchester City to sign him.

The Villa captain has been in good form for his boyhood club this season with four goals and four assists, leading calls for the talented midfielder to be called up to Gareth Southgate's England squad.

The City boss oversaw his City side's comfortable 3-0 victory over Grealish's Villa, but the Spaniard was full of praise for the midfielder after the game.

Pep Guardolia claimed Aston Villa's Jack Grealish would be 'too expensive' for City to sign

JACK GREALISH THIS SEASON Appearances: 12 Goals: 4 Assists: 4

'He's incredible,' said Pep when asked about Grealish's performance.

'A top player. I'm happy he (initially) stayed in the Championship to defend his club.

'He's a talented player who always creates something. An exceptional player but too expensive for Manchester!'

The claim comes a surprise considering the financial firepower seemingly at Guardiola's disposal at the Etihad, with City's squad almost completely made up of big-money signings.

Grealish was at the heart of Villa's promotion-winning campaign last season and has settled in comfortably to life back in the Premier League which has led him to be named as a potential target for the league's big clubs.

Former Villa boss Tim Sherwood recently praised his former player, saying that clubs such as Manchester United be targeting Grealish at a price of £70million.

Grealish put in a spirited display for the Villans despite the tough opposition he faced, and the fact that the 24-year-old was forced off through injury will be a cause for concern for Villa boss Dean Smith.
description: Pep Guardiola claimed Aston Villa's Jack Grealish is 'too expensive' for Manchester City to sign him. The Spaniard made the bold claim after City's comfortable 3-0 win over Villa at the Etihad.
